channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pole hole too big, 18th January
item.description:
The pole holes have been there for years now and no repairs haven’t been done now from Essex county council I never seen anyone repairing the pole holes on wellington hill it needs to be repaired as soon as possible

item.title: Report 8667933, 18th January
item.description:
I reprted this a week ago - lamp F 62-5 - not working (report 8667933). I received an email saying the contractor had been notified and then on 15 Jan that appropriate action had been taken. The report is now marked as closed. Action does NOT seem to have been taken. The light is still not working. Please sort this out. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned over a month ago with side mirror knocked off, 18th January
item.description:
Causing hazards getting past at peak times as near big roundabout entrance onto poverest road. Clearly been stolen with how it is left as doesn’t look like it’s been in accident otherwise why left there at the most dangerous place.so many reports made and you closed it because it is taxed. Met police make a big thing about resolving these kind of things and public is letting you know but clearly not resolved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 224, Chislehurst Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of lighting in Spa car park, 18th January
item.description:
The lighting is broken or non-existant in the car park at The Spa Leisure Centre. It makes the car park dangerous to use after dark: risk of being knocked over by a moving car because driver can't see pedestrian on foot. Many young families have classes after dark. This is a very real risk. This has been reported to you already by others and is long overdue to be fixed. Please make it a PRIORITY. I used the car park last week in the evening and it felt VERY unsafe. Thank you for your attention in this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Beckenham Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover on Ballards Lane near LL bus stop, 18th January
item.description:
The issue concerns a loose manhole cover that is producing an extremely loud and persistent rattling noise whenever vehicles pass over it. The noise has been ongoing for several months and has steadily worsened over time. When I initially reported the matter by phone, I was transferred to the Highway Maintenance Department, where my complaint was logged under reference number 11098948. I was explicitly advised that the issue would be resolved within 10 working days. Unfortunately, despite this assurance, no remedial action has been taken to date. The situation has now become intolerable. The noise is disruptive throughout the day and is particularly severe at night, significantly disturbing our sleep and affecting our quality of life. This prolonged delay is unacceptable, especially given the clear impact on residents and the fact that the issue was acknowledged months ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montrose Crescent, Fallow Corner, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working, 18th January
item.description:
There are at least 5 street lights not working outside Co op and heading towards Pope Street. It's making the area very dark, particularly over the railway bridge. We have noticed lights not working on Green Lane recently too and reported them. Not sure why they keep being turned off?!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Novar Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet
